result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miriam E Mclemore

records.addlTxt:
(3:12 PM cases 21CM649, 21CM720, 22CF1, 22CF488, 22CF984 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Miriam E Mclemore in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Miriam E Mclemore. Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rivard makes record as to why he is appearing via Zoom and that Court granted permission earlier in the day.
Defendant has no objection with Attorney Rivard appearing via video.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearings in cases 22CF1, 22CF488, 22CF984 and Court accepts waivers.
Attorney Rivard to schedule an Arraignment in cases 22CF1, 22CF488, 22CF984 and Hearing in cases 21CM649, 21CM720 with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.

10:00 AM cases 21CM649, 21CM720, 22CF1, 22CF488, 22CF984 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Miriam E Mclemore in court, in custody with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. Attorney Rivard requests a preliminary hearing in felony cases. Other matters are to ride along.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:12 AM cases 22CF488, 22CF01, 21CM720, 21CM649 and 22CF984 called. Defendant Miriam E Mclemore in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Kohler appeared on behalf of the defendant. In 22CF488, 22CF01, 21CM720, 21CM649 warrants have been executed. 
In 22CF984: Defense waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court orders a $250 cash bond. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 9-14-22 at 2:45 PM. 
Return to court: 10-4-22 at 9:30 AM.

9:59 AM Cases called: 21CM649, 21CM720, 22CF1 & 22CF488 Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Miriam E Mclemore not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Miriam E Mclemore. Attorney Rivard has had no contact with Defendant. Warrant ordered.

ADDRESS INFO for Miriam E Mclemore
Current: 2035 Schultz St, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Homeless,

(Cases called at 11:13 AM - 22CF488, 22CF1, 21CM720, 21CM649)
Defendant Miriam Mclemore appears in custody via videoconference from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier.  Attorney Afton Lewis appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrant executed and bond continues.  
Return Hearing: 8/10/2022 at 9:30 AM

9:58 AM Cases called: 21CM649, 21CM720, 22CF1 & 22CF488. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Miriam E Mclemore not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Miriam E Mclemore. Warrant ordered in each case.

Conditions: 
No Contact with any Kwik Trip locations.

11:06 AM cases 21CM720, 21CM64, 22CF1 and 22CF488 called. Court Commissioner Nathan Novak for Branch 5 Intake.  Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Miriam E Mclemore appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Kate Cook. 
In 22CF488: Defense waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
In all other files: Warrants are quashed, bond continues. 
All files: Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5-23-22 at 1:45 PM. Return to court: 6-6-22 at 9:30 AM.
